Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: FPGA's are much more power efficient, too. So if some miners are not mining because your power is too expensive, FPGA's change the numbers. The people who sell the blackminer F1 have a hosted solution where they charge 10 cents per kw/h for power and evidently it's still profitable and many people go that route

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Mempool isn't as sending around so well I think, I've been noticing this more and more, not sure of how its supposed to work, but it appears that txs don't really propagate once they have been sent the one time... I had to fetch them with raw tx and then resend on another node to get them to actually propagate to a node that was restarted. Dunno if this is expected behaviour or not, but its darn annoying when trying g to test mining prioritys n things.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @blackjok3r I noticed this too, seems it started around the Dec hardfork

Author: Alright#0419
Content: I haven't been able to pinpoint what exactly changed, but spamming transactions that spend the previous tx's outputs causes problems now

Author: Alright#0419
Content: RejectToMemoryPool "input not found" thing

ComputerGenie å‡¸(âŠ™â–‚âŠ™ )å‡¸Today at 4:09 PM
@Ederwa do you have a log of what you pool was trying to send? RPC_WALLET_ERROR                = -4,  //! Unspecified problem with wallet so you're going to have to have some detail on your end in order for anyone to help you

Content: hello I'm the guy looking for an open source miner for zcash / komodo. Sorry for the delay, I was busy. Thank you for the invitation.

Author: phm87#7395
Content: I had a look at the commits about sapling in kmd-nomp it doesn't seem very complicated on pool side

Author: phm87#7395
Content: but I don't know for miner's side : there is a miner included into komodo daemon itself, I had a look at the sapling code inside it but it is still hard to know exactly what to do into ccminer

Content: @phm87 what are you actually trying to do?

Author: phm87#7395
Content: I am trying to add sapling into yiimp mining pool (on zpool) to be able to mine kmd/zcash again

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: yiimp is some crazy ass C++ stratum code. I understand stratum protocol, but writing it in C++ makes me un-understand it. Maybe something to do with the fact that I maintain a Perl stratum implementation, which is used by hushwebminer. It's just a few lines of Perl to implement stratum, C++ implementation is a monstrosity to behold

Author: ComputerGenie ğŸ‘´ğŸ¼ğŸ“¢#7004
Content: @phm87 if you want to add sapling to yiimp, how does the miner come into play? Or are you wanting that also?

Author: phm87#7395
Content: I think that with sapling the miner receive the finalsaplingroothash given by stratum. But then I am not sure what calculation the miner must perform with the finalsaplingroothash

Author: ComputerGenie ğŸ‘´ğŸ¼ğŸ“¢#7004
Content: ahhhh

Author: ComputerGenie ğŸ‘´ğŸ¼ğŸ“¢#7004
Content:
the miners do not need any change from sprout to sapling
the stratum itself need the update and the changes are small enough that the miners will not be effected

Author: ComputerGenie ğŸ‘´ğŸ¼ğŸ“¢#7004
Content: nothing in the algorithm changed, just the design of the block template

Author: ComputerGenie ğŸ‘´ğŸ¼ğŸ“¢#7004
